column4: He just means that he was having trouble remembering the command to pass ubottu.
would be my guess :) But you never know....
In terminal type: rm -rf .gnome .gnome2 .gconf .gconfd .metacity
After that, log out, and log back in, or restart X.

well, it seems kinda... brutal. I think last time I did that, it reset all my preferences for single apps, and it also removed my Evolution inboxes. Thing is, it says failsafe gnome, but only thing it does is not load a window manager, and as soon as I run compiz, my ordinary session works fine....
Maybe you should just try reconfiguring gdm orubuntu-desktop..........
one more clue... My wife's account works fine, in gnome, only login to my own account doesn't work
Unfortunately, that only solidifies my belief that you should should delete those directories :p

Hmm... It seems odd, though, since everything works fine as soon as I log in and manually restart a few things.  So I guess, most of these configuration files are not the key...? (I know, I'm writhing and trying to avoid it here...)
Well, you have a point. It kind of sounds like X may just not be initializing properly.
yes, and it's clearly a personal setting for the x session. Wonder if there's one single file there to mess with - or simply delete?
but then again. X initialises fine in KDE4, so it's clearly a gnome/Xsession interaction thing... right?
I'd say so. Does your wife use KDE or Gnome?
I have a suspicion it happened when I messed around with assigning different groups to my personal user...
thanks :) We'll see....

Here are my thoughts: Delete those directories (which should NEVER have done anything to your Evolution, by the way), try sudo dpkg-reconfigure ubuntu-desktop and sudo dpkg-reconfigure gdm. Also, if you have to, you can create a fresh user account for yourself and transfer your personal data over to your new home directory.
